Subject: Stealth Audit Folder Permissions
Description: Our vulnerability monitoring tools has detected that our version of Stealth Audit (11.5.1355.1197) has a vulnerability (Insecure Windows Service Permissions). Plugin Output: Path : c:program files (x86)stealthbitsstealthauditvaultservice.exe Used by services : StealthAUDITVault File write allowed for groups : Users (S-1-5-32-545) Path : c:program files (x86)stealthbitsstealthauditwebwebserver.exe Used by services : StealthAUDITWeb File write allowed for groups : Users (S-1-5-32-545) I am not sure if this is an intended configuration or was something that was modified in a troubleshooting effort.
Solution_Comment__c:
The customer wanted to know why all users show Read & Execute Read & Modify. I explained to the customer that he has users in the administrator group under Settings> Access.
I told him that if these users were only Report Viewers or Job Viewers, they would only show two permissions (Read & Execute and Read).
